caption: A melancholic acoustic folk song with fingerpicked guitar, gentle cello, and intimate female vocals. The sparse arrangement features subtle harmonium drones and soft percussion, creating a contemplative atmosphere of quiet reflection.
lyrics:
[Intro]

[Verse 1]
Autumn leaves are falling down
Covering this sleepy town
I walk alone these empty streets
Where our memories still meet

[Verse 2]
The coffee shop where we first talked
The park bench where we always walked
Now just ghosts of what we were
Seasons change but I'm still here

[Chorus]
Like the river flows to sea
You flowed right out of me
And I'm left here wondering
Where did all the time go
Where did all the time go

[Verse 3]
I found your letter yesterday
Words you never got to say
Folded up and tucked away
In a box of yesterday

[Chorus]
Like the river flows to sea
You flowed right out of me
And I'm left here wondering
Where did all the time go
Where did all the time go

[Bridge]
Maybe someday I'll understand
Why you let go of my hand

[Outro]
Where did all the time go
